name: Python
fact: Python was invented by a man

name: Javascript
fact: Javascript was written in two weeks

name: Java
fact: Java was originally designed for interactive television

name: C++
fact: C++ was developed by Bjarne Stroustrup at Bell Labs

name: Ruby
fact: Ruby was influenced by Perl, Smalltalk, Eiffel, Ada, and Lisp

name: Swift
fact: Swift was developed by Apple for iOS and Mac apps

name: Go
fact: Go was developed at Google in response to the company's problems with concurrent programming

name: Rust
fact: Rust is designed to be memory safe without garbage collection

name: Kotlin
fact: Kotlin is officially supported by Google for Android development

name: TypeScript
fact: TypeScript is a strict syntactical superset of JavaScript

name: Scala
fact: Scala is designed to express common programming patterns in a concise, elegant, and type-safe way

name: Perl
fact: Perl was originally developed for text manipulation

name: PHP
fact: PHP originally stood for 'Personal Home Page'

name: Lua
fact: Lua is commonly used in game development

name: R
fact: R is widely used for statistical computing and graphics

name: Elixir
fact: Elixir is a dynamic, functional language designed for building scalable and maintainable applications

name: Haskell
fact: Haskell is a statically typed, purely functional programming language

name: Groovy
fact: Groovy is a powerful, optionally typed and dynamic language, with static-typing and static compilation capabilities

name: Clojure
fact: Clojure is a robust, practical, and fast programming language with a set of useful features that together form a simple, coherent, and powerful tool

name: Erlang
fact: Erlang is a programming language used to build massively scalable soft real-time systems with requirements on high availability

name: F#
fact: F# is a mature, open source, cross-platform, functional-first programming language

name: Dart
fact: Dart is a client-optimized language for fast apps on any platform

name: Objective-C
fact: Objective-C was the main programming language used by Apple for macOS and iOS development before Swift

name: Shell
fact: Shell scripting is used for automating routine tasks in Unix-like operating systems

name: MATLAB
fact: MATLAB is widely used in academia and industry for mathematical modeling

name: Fortran
fact: Fortran is one of the oldest high-level programming languages, first developed in the 1950s

name: COBOL
fact: COBOL is widely used in legacy applications deployed on mainframe computers

name: Assembly
fact: Assembly language is a low-level programming language for a computer, or other programmable device

name: Prolog
fact: Prolog is a logic programming language associated with artificial intelligence and computational linguistics

name: Lisp
fact: Lisp (for 'List Processing') is one of the oldest high-level programming languages, first conceived in 1958

name: Ada
fact: Ada is a structured, statically typed, imperative, and object-oriented high-level computer programming language

name: Julia
fact: Julia is a high-level, high-performance dynamic programming language for technical computing

name: C#
fact: C# is a modern, object-oriented programming language developed by Microsoft
